alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:21AM EST until February 19 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... White River, Eagle Creek, and Eel River. .Melted snowpack combined with rainfall amounts of one to over two inches from Wednesday evening through today falling on frozen ground has caused significant runoff which will produce flooding along area rivers. Along the main stem rivers, flooding could be lengthened and possibly worsened by another storm system next week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Muncie. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Flooding of lowlands across Delaware County outside of the city of Muncie. Only high levels in the city of Muncie. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 9.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later today.
